snippet.textDisplay: +Therealguymins I see where you're coming from. The Genesis wasn't necessarily striving towards instrumentation. Initially, it seemed to gravitate more towards electric, grittier sound. Later on, however, they just had to deal with what they were dealt in the beginning, and in the end, produced some of the greatest soundtracks in gaming history. At least in my opinion.
snippet.textOriginal: +Therealguymins I see where you're coming from. The Genesis wasn't necessarily striving towards instrumentation. Initially, it seemed to gravitate more towards electric, grittier sound. Later on, however, they just had to deal with what they were dealt in the beginning, and in the end, produced some of the greatest soundtracks in gaming history. At least in my opinion.

snippet.textDisplay:
I had a 20 minute presentation somewhere about the Prime games (school) and why I think they succeeded and stuff. But even then I wouldn't hate anyone for having a honest opinion. 

Afterall, even though I think the discovery formula for Metroid is my most favorite thing, I like that the series can also be viewed differently because it just has a lot of things going for it. It's like me taking a liking to FF XIII even though it's bashed a lot (though it's more of a guilty pleasure in my case)
snippet.textOriginal:
I had a 20 minute presentation somewhere about the Prime games (school) and why I think they succeeded and stuff. But even then I wouldn't hate anyone for having a honest opinion. 

Afterall, even though I think the discovery formula for Metroid is my most favorite thing, I like that the series can also be viewed differently because it just has a lot of things going for it. It's like me taking a liking to FF XIII even though it's bashed a lot (though it's more of a guilty pleasure in my case)

snippet.textDisplay:
Third, so many other games have used the Metroidvania formula - even going away from 2D ones there's BioShock, Dark Souls, and the new Tomb Raider to name some major examples, and a sense of discovery can be found in other games too like Shadow of the Colossus and Journey.  

But that's just my take on it.
snippet.textOriginal:
Third, so many other games have used the Metroidvania formula - even going away from 2D ones there's BioShock, Dark Souls, and the new Tomb Raider to name some major examples, and a sense of discovery can be found in other games too like Shadow of the Colossus and Journey.  

But that's just my take on it.

snippet.textDisplay: Afterwards, both 2D and 3D Metroid were showing signs of becoming stale, particularly the former.  I guess I simply had a problem with the series just feeling like the same darn game every time so I'm glad that Other M shakes up the formula so much.
snippet.textOriginal: Afterwards, both 2D and 3D Metroid were showing signs of becoming stale, particularly the former.  I guess I simply had a problem with the series just feeling like the same darn game every time so I'm glad that Other M shakes up the formula so much.

snippet.textDisplay: I guess the problem there is how I view the series myself.  I play it more for Samus herself and the series' sci-fi aesthetic than the exploration.  Furthermore, Metroid Prime is IMO better than Super Metroid in every way (though Prime is my favorite game of all time), and perfected the series' signature sense of discovery.
snippet.textOriginal: I guess the problem there is how I view the series myself.  I play it more for Samus herself and the series' sci-fi aesthetic than the exploration.  Furthermore, Metroid Prime is IMO better than Super Metroid in every way (though Prime is my favorite game of all time), and perfected the series' signature sense of discovery.

snippet.textDisplay: The stupid thing is that I started replaying Other M a few days ago and I absolutely love it so far - I'd even say it's right up there with the best in the series.  Please don't hurt me for my opinion!
snippet.textOriginal: The stupid thing is that I started replaying Other M a few days ago and I absolutely love it so far - I'd even say it's right up there with the best in the series.  Please don't hurt me for my opinion!

snippet.textDisplay:
To be honest, the problem with Other M moreso than any other thing is that it lacked what Metroid was so damn good at. If there's one word I would use to describe Metroid, it would be discovery. Just the way you are send on an unknown alien planet without much knowledge makes it all the more satisfying when you find something. Prime extended this by making the story it's own collectable (scans).

Other M's gameplay isn't necessarily bad, but unfortunately it took away what we love about it.
snippet.textOriginal:
To be honest, the problem with Other M moreso than any other thing is that it lacked what Metroid was so damn good at. If there's one word I would use to describe Metroid, it would be discovery. Just the way you are send on an unknown alien planet without much knowledge makes it all the more satisfying when you find something. Prime extended this by making the story it's own collectable (scans).

Other M's gameplay isn't necessarily bad, but unfortunately it took away what we love about it.

snippet.textDisplay:
I would honestly sooner insert vehicle and/or turret sections into Other M before I did any tinkering with its storyline or script (which was garbage, but I can live with it).

My main gripe with that game was lack of gameplay variety.
snippet.textOriginal:
I would honestly sooner insert vehicle and/or turret sections into Other M before I did any tinkering with its storyline or script (which was garbage, but I can live with it).

My main gripe with that game was lack of gameplay variety.

snippet.textDisplay:
Okay, maybe the whole "turn Metroid into Halo" was not the greatest idea.

I basically want more gameplay variety.  That was my biggest gripe with Other M, and the lack of gameplay variety there was especially bizarre considering how stuff like Twilight Princess and Super Mario Galaxy expanded on gameplay variety compared to previous entries in their series.
snippet.textOriginal:
Okay, maybe the whole "turn Metroid into Halo" was not the greatest idea.

I basically want more gameplay variety.  That was my biggest gripe with Other M, and the lack of gameplay variety there was especially bizarre considering how stuff like Twilight Princess and Super Mario Galaxy expanded on gameplay variety compared to previous entries in their series.

snippet.textDisplay:
Nintendo, either make a new 2D Metroid, or make a new 3D Metroid that has more gameplay variety than any previous game in the series.  I want to see Samus man turrets and enter morph ball mazes again, not to mention maybe some extra features like...perhaps vehicle combat?

And for those of you who says that sounds to "shooter"-like, I personally feel that the Prime 2/3 added plenty of shooter elements anyway.
snippet.textOriginal:

And for those of you who says that sounds to "shooter"-like, I personally feel that the Prime 2/3 added plenty of shooter elements anyway.

snippet.textDisplay:
@disgaeahavok Take a look at the game's opening again. According to the game's canon, the scientists who treat Samus after the X infect her have to surgically remove parts of her Varia Suit(this occurs before they concoct the Metroid-based vaccine, of course. This all takes place in the prologue). The parts are then moved to the Quarantine Bay, which is where you first spot the SA-X.

As for how the X got her DNA.. Samus' power suit is bonded to her symbiotically. It contains her DNA.
snippet.textOriginal:
@disgaeahavok Take a look at the game's opening again. According to the game's canon, the scientists who treat Samus after the X infect her have to surgically remove parts of her Varia Suit(this occurs before they concoct the Metroid-based vaccine, of course. This all takes place in the prologue). The parts are then moved to the Quarantine Bay, which is where you first spot the SA-X.

As for how the X got her DNA.. Samus' power suit is bonded to her symbiotically. It contains her DNA.

snippet.textDisplay: La atmosfera de este juego es impresionante,sin duda es estupendo el juego este.
snippet.textOriginal: La atmosfera de este juego es impresionante,sin duda es estupendo el juego este.

snippet.textDisplay: @disgaeahavok Scientists had to surgically remove parts of her suit which were infected by the X, and the X used these parts to form SA-X. The vaccine only destroyed the X's which were embedded in her central nervous system, but not the ones on her suit. Therefore, the X used the removed suit to form SA-X. This is also the explanation as to why the SA-X looks more like Samus than Samus herself, since her OLD SUIT was copied, and how the SA-X has no visible pupils.
snippet.textOriginal: @disgaeahavok Scientists had to surgically remove parts of her suit which were infected by the X, and the X used these parts to form SA-X. The vaccine only destroyed the X's which were embedded in her central nervous system, but not the ones on her suit. Therefore, the X used the removed suit to form SA-X. This is also the explanation as to why the SA-X looks more like Samus than Samus herself, since her OLD SUIT was copied, and how the SA-X has no visible pupils.

snippet.textDisplay: @disgaeahavok Um, that's great that you have your own theory, but it's kinda completely impossible. At the end of Corruption, Phaaze is destroyed, and all Phazon in the universe is destroyed with it. Furthermore, all creatures that were infected with Phazon or mutated by it reverted to their original state, which is indicated and proven by Samus' bloodstream being purged of all traces of it(as you can see, she's not even wearing the PED in the final cutscene).
snippet.textOriginal: @disgaeahavok Um, that's great that you have your own theory, but it's kinda completely impossible. At the end of Corruption, Phaaze is destroyed, and all Phazon in the universe is destroyed with it. Furthermore, all creatures that were infected with Phazon or mutated by it reverted to their original state, which is indicated and proven by Samus' bloodstream being purged of all traces of it(as you can see, she's not even wearing the PED in the final cutscene).

snippet.textDisplay: This was my first Metroid game, and I still love it to this day.  I plan to play through it again when my Gameboy Micro comes in.  It's interesting how this game was so much more atmospheric and creepy (and good!) than Metroid Prime: Hunters even though Hunters was superior in graphics and sound.  Hey Nintendo: there is NO reason to not do another 2D Metroid.  Thumbs up if you want Dread!
snippet.textOriginal: This was my first Metroid game, and I still love it to this day.  I plan to play through it again when my Gameboy Micro comes in.  It's interesting how this game was so much more atmospheric and creepy (and good!) than Metroid Prime: Hunters even though Hunters was superior in graphics and sound.  Hey Nintendo: there is NO reason to not do another 2D Metroid.  Thumbs up if you want Dread!

snippet.textDisplay: @omegafreddy12 Except by that same logic, Dark Samus isn't a "she" either, asshole. Phazon absorbs and consumes biological entities just the way the X Parasite does, and it wasn't just CONSIDERED for use as biological warfare by the Galactic Federation, it WAS used for it by both them and the Space Pirate forces(Phazon Troopers/Elite Troopers/Omega Pirate in MP1, PED Troopers and Pirates in MP3).
snippet.textOriginal: @omegafreddy12 Except by that same logic, Dark Samus isn't a "she" either, asshole. Phazon absorbs and consumes biological entities just the way the X Parasite does, and it wasn't just CONSIDERED for use as biological warfare by the Galactic Federation, it WAS used for it by both them and the Space Pirate forces(Phazon Troopers/Elite Troopers/Omega Pirate in MP1, PED Troopers and Pirates in MP3).

snippet.textDisplay:
I remember playing this game back in June and then noticing that a new Fusion-esque Metroid game was on the way, and thus getting super hyped for it.

Unlike that game this really is super awesome.  The soundtrack isn't as good as Super Metroid but it's still excellent, which is saying something.
snippet.textOriginal:
I remember playing this game back in June and then noticing that a new Fusion-esque Metroid game was on the way, and thus getting super hyped for it.

Unlike that game this really is super awesome.  The soundtrack isn't as good as Super Metroid but it's still excellent, which is saying something.

snippet.textDisplay:
If this game gets remade in 3D, not only would it be as cool as the original, it would be very scary.  Really, this game goes into the survival horror category at times.

I love Fusion so much.

snippet.textDisplay: The SA-X. An enemy with my strongest abilities. But has it reason? Probably not. It´s just a killing maschine. In my current state, I can´t face it head-on. The SA-X is me, only heartless. I must stop it before it learns its potensial and threatens the universe...
snippet.textOriginal: The SA-X. An enemy with my strongest abilities. But has it reason? Probably not. It´s just a killing maschine. In my current state, I can´t face it head-on. The SA-X is me, only heartless. I must stop it before it learns its potensial and threatens the universe...
